chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Carter R Radde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Both Cts 1 & 3 are concurrent with one another, with conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. 
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

Def is not to be present at bars or taverns, with the exception of employment upon approval of the supervising agent

Def is not to be present at any location where illicit drugs or controlled substances are kept, used, sold or distributed
.

Def to pay restitution of $314.10 to Altra Federal Credit Union.  Def is requesting a Restitution Hearing regarding restitution owed to A.K. - restitution to be held open until hearing is held

Pay 10% restitution surcharge (see 'other' above)
.

Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay Mandatory Court costs/fees, to include Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee of $13 (see 'other' above), on Ct 1.  On Ct 3, def is to pay Victim/Witness surcharge of $67 and $200 DNA surcharge only ($267).  The remaining Court costs/fees on Ct 3 are REMITTED due to indigency

Cash bond of $250 is applied toward financial obligation owed

All Court-ordered financial obligations, including restitution and surcharge, shall be paid directly to the La Crosse County Clerk of Court.  If the defendant is no table to pay the amount in full, the first payment shall be made within 90 days with monthly payments to follow

Pay DOC Supervision fees (not shown) - to be paid to the Dept of Corrections

Credit for 52 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt 
.
Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
